abstract: Abstract Electronic Health Record (EHR) tables pose unique challenges among which is the presence of hidden contextual dependencies between medical features with a high level of data dimensionality and sparsity. This study presents the first …

title: Graph Neural Networks for Predicting Side Effects and New Indications of Drugs Using Electronic Health Records
details: J Sharma, M Lentzen, S Krix, T Linden - Informed Machine Learning, 2025
abstract: Drug development is a costly and time-intensive process. However, promising strategies such as drug repositioning and side effect prediction can help to overcome these challenges. Repurposing approved drugs can significantly reduce the time and …

title: PIE-Med: Predicting, Interpreting and Explaining Medical Recommendations
details: A Romano, G Riccio, M Postiglione, V Moscato - European Conference on …, 2025
abstract: We introduce PIE-Med, a novel Clinical Decision Support System (CDSS) that integrates Graph Convolutional Networks (GCNs) and Large Language Models (LLMs) to deliver interpretable medical recommendations. PIE-Med leverages GCNs …
